alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 9:37AM CST until January 31 at 8:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Near Folsom. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Areas of Spring Park and Albert Thompson Road will be inundated. Homes will flood if the river rises higher. Evacuation of those areas is recommended. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Monday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 8.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 12/19/2009. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
